content.prompt: The parametric function f is given by ft=xt,yt, where xt=5-t2 and yt=-5+2t for -3≤t≤3. Which of the following is the graph of f in the xy-plane?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 10 to 0 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from 0 to 9 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. 

  • One endpoint of the curve is at (negative 9 comma 8).
  • The curve decreases gradually to pass through (negative 4 comma 4) and (negative 1 comma 2).
  • The curve reaches the point (0 comma 1) and then moves left.
  • The curve gradually decreases from right to left, passing through (negative 1 comma 0.5) and ending at (negative 9 comma 0.1).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from 5 to 14 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. 

  • One endpoint of the curve is at (14 comma negative 3).
  • The curve moves left from this point, gradually increasing from right to left to pass through (10.4 comma 0), (9 comma 1), and (6 comma 3).
  • The curve reaches the point (5 comma 4) and then moves right.
  • The curve gradually increases from left to right and ends at the point (14 comma 4.9).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 3 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from 5 to 14 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve begins at (negative 4.9 comma 14).
  • The curve decreases sharply to the point (negative 4 comma 5), reaching its minimum.
  • The curve increases through (negative 3 comma 6) and (negative 1 comma 9).
  • The curve ends at (3 comma 14).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. 

  • One endpoint of the curve is at (negative 4 comma 3).
  • The curve decreases gradually to pass through (1 comma negative 1) and (4 comma negative 3).
  • The curve reaches the point (5 comma negative 4) and then moves left.
  • The curve gradually decreases from right to left, ending at (negative 4 comma negative 4.9).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
